title: Ardsley Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: SMJ / Ardsley Reservoir
images.caption: Ardsley Reservoir. The reservoir is on top of Haigh Moor, these pipes were filling it.

images.title: SMJ / Ardsley Reservoir Dam
images.caption: View of the dam at the site

images.title: SMJ / Farm rooftops
images.caption: Farm rooftops and surrounding countryside. View from the end of the dam at Ardsley Reservoir

images.title: Steve Partridge / Ardsley Reservoir
images.caption: Atmospheric shot of the reservoir at dusk. This shot was taken from below the normal waterline, the reservoir being quite depleted. The railings guard an overspill while the skyline is the dam.

description: This circular walk takes you around Ardsley Reservoir in East Ardsley, near Tingley in Leeds. It's a nice easy stroll with the path running for just over a mile on a nice flat footpath. There's good views of Emley Moor and Haigh Moor in what is a very peaceful and picturesque spot. You can start the walk from the small car park, located on the eastern side of the water. Postcode for your sat navs is WF3 1EE. The Leeds Country Way passes just to the west of the reservoir. This waymarked long distance path is a great way of exploring the surrounding area on foot. You can pick it up in West Ardsley near the Hey Beck. It will take you towards Batley in one direction or Wakefield in the other.
